node.title: WA's COVID roadmap to be released on Friday, on the eve of NSW border rules easing
node.description: The WA government will release a roadmap on Friday for transitioning to living with COVID-19, a day before it downgrades New South Wales from an "extreme risk" state to "high risk".
node.content:
["The WA\u00a0government has announced it will release a roadmap on Friday for transitioning to living with COVID-19, a day before it eases\u00a0border restrictions with New South Wales.", "Premier Mark McGowan said that, as of 12:01am on Saturday, New South Wales would transition from \"extreme risk\"\u00a0to \"high risk\", based on the latest health advice.", "He said exemptions under the high-risk category would be limited to certain senior government officials and active military personnel, Commonwealth MPs and officials, limited specialists and people given approval by the State Emergency Coordinator.", "Exemptions will also be given to West Australians who\u00a0may have travelled to New South Wales recently, have roots in Western Australia\u00a0and have a legitimate right to return, subject to the relevant quarantine conditions and required evidence.", "", "
Travel from New South Wales to Western Australia will still be heavily\u00a0restricted under the change.(ABC News: Rachel Pupazzoni)
", "Approved travellers from New South Wales must be fully vaccinated to enter Western Australia, have proof of a negative COVID-19 test in the 72 hours prior to departure, self-quarantine for 14 days and use the G2G Now app.", "
Health funding, roadmap to fight\u00a0COVID-19
", "The news came as Mr McGowan announced new funding to prepare the state's hospital system for COVID-19.", "He\u00a0said the roadmap to\u00a0be unveiled this Friday would outline how the state would shift to living with the virus.", "\"We will release our transition plan on Friday, which will detail a lot of those matters,\" the Premier said.", "\"It has been carefully worked through, carefully calibrated for the West Australian context.", "Mr McGowan said the state government would spend an additional $400 million on 270 new beds across the health system to prepare for when COVID-19 entered Western Australia.", "", "
Face masks are likely to return in Western Australia\u00a0as part of the state's COVID-19 roadmap.(ABC News: Hugh Sando)
", "He said this funding was in additional to that announced in the state budget.", "\"We had to prepare for when COVID inevitably gets here, you have to be able to judge what will be the demand,\" he said.", "\"That is the work that has been going on since the state budget.\"", "
More hospital beds, doctors and nurses
", "The 270 new beds are expected to cost around $206 million, with around $191 million to fund 410 extra nurses and more than 180 extra doctors.", "\"We are bringing on additional beds both in private hospitals, in existing hospitals\u00a0and modular beds, so we can cope with when COVID gets here,\" Mr McGowan said.", "\"This more than caters for what we expect will be the demand from COVID when it gets here some time\u00a0next year.\"", "", "
How to take a rapid antigen test
"]
